result.execSummary:
The defendant Dayleen M Bergsrud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 5 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
Deft is ordered to provide a DNA specimen prior being released from jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 07-25-2015 at 03:00 am
Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Dayleen M Bergsrud in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Charlotte Lacey.
Plea - Ct.1 - NC.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.   Ct.2 - DRI.
5 days RCJ, cfts;
Deft is ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$100+cc+DNA, pp $25/mo beg 8-24-15, ftp 5 days RCJ for contempt.

  ***Eligible for expungement. Payment of fine and costs and ZCI fees must be paid in full prior to expungement.***

  ***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY***
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***6-3-15 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO REMOVE GPS MONITORING. DEFT IS ALLOWED TO DRIVE AS LONG AS PROPERLY LICENSED ***  ***5-13-15 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO ALLOW DEFT TO ATTEND HIGH SCHOOL WHILE ON GPS MONITORING. DEFT MAY ATTEND GRADUATION ON 6/7/15***  No contact with the co-defendant, NCC. Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/her Atty.  Do not drive at all.  No contact with her boyfriend (person, property, residence or family). No boys are allowed in the home.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dayleen M Bergsrud in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled on Def's Motion to modify bond.
Def is requesting that bond be modified to remove the GPS so the deft will be able to drive.
Deft is graduating H.S. on Sunday and attending college in the fall and has orientation on Monday.
Deft's grandmother also depends on her granddaughter to take care of errands.
State would not oppose to the deft being able to drive but thinks GPS is necessary.
Deft's grandmother is present if the court would like to speak to her.
BTC: Motion to modify bond granted, modify bond to remove GPS monitoring and allow deft to drive.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***5-13-15 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO ALLOW DEFT TO ATTEND HIGH SCHOOL WHILE ON GPS MONITORING. DEFT MAY ATTEND GRADUATION ON 6/7/15***  No contact with the co-defendant, NCC. Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/her Atty.  Do not drive at all.  No contact with her boyfriend (person, property, residence or family). No boys are allowed in the home.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dayleen M Bergsrud in court with attorney Erin Larsen for Trisha Janet Fritz.  Robin K. Green for Tom Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.
Matter is scheduled on Def's Motion to modify conditions of bond.
Def is requesting that the deft be able to attend school.
BTC: Modify conditions of bond to allow deft to attend High School during school hours. Deft may attend graduation on 6/7/15.
Bail/bond hearing on May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 28, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
